column4: Is there anyway to accidently install grub2 twice on a hard drive?
the first time gave me file not found, but 2nd try worked
i just want to make sure the first time i tried didn't install anything on one of the partitions
or does grub ONLY install to devices?
you should be good. it will just write to mbr unless you ask it to do otherwise
how do i find out which one is being used?
what do you mean unless you ask it to do otherwise?
i think it is possible to write grub to a partition
no need to remove any of them. only one of them will be in use. the one that resides on the dist the BIOS jumps to
how do i remove the one I don't need?
i think so yes, if you installed it on a partition

thats not a problem, unless you want something else there. The thing is, grub doesn't change what disk your BIOS jumps to. BIOS always only jumps to one disk, if it finds grub there the rest goes well
yes you want to know what grub is in use so you update the right one, I was just saying that having a copy of grub on another disk doesnt hurt in any way
so you have installed grub on /dev/sdb1 or something?
do you know what /dev/sdb1 points to?
are you sure that one can be deleted?
im 99% sure :D
i would be careful with that
gimme 1 min...
if you do: less /boot/grub/grub.cfg you should be able to see if it uses / or /media/SYSTEM RECOVERY
its a bit messy but it should say something like "linux   /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.35-27-generic"
